poem:
**Glastonbury Reverie**

A stroll past Inhaler,  
where notes slip through fingers—  
a silent melody in black,  
like faces half-formed in a cloud,  
handsome shadows lost.  

Music echoes in hollow spaces,  
a concert of almost,  
while the earth spins underfoot,  
and all the world's a waiting stage  
in a purgatoried haze.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Friday at Glastonbury with CMAT, Lorde, Wet Leg, secret sets and more – follow it live! 4.05pm BST Wandered past Inhaler after Jalen Ngonda and there was something actually eerie about the total void where tunes should be – like all the signifiers of a good rock band (handsome singer; strutting and noisy music; black clothing) but nothing to hold them together. Felt like being in some purgatorial Matrix where the AI hasn’t fully worked". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Friday at Glastonbury with CMAT, Lorde, Wet Leg, secret sets and more – follow it live! 4.05pm BST Wandered past Inhaler after Jalen Ngonda and there was something actually eerie about the total void where tunes should be – like all the signifiers of a good rock band (handsome singer; strutting and noisy music; black clothing) but nothing to hold them together. Felt like being in some purgatorial Matrix where the AI hasn’t fully worked
